creator: psancho.asf@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 28996
ImageException trace

Using FOP 1.0 + FOP-pdf-images 2.0 works fine
Using FOP 1.1RC1 + FOP-pdf-images build from latest trunk throws an ImageException
and the PDF produced doesn't contain the image.pdf

Created attachment 28998
image that comes with test case
creator: psancho.asf@gmail.com

i think you uploaded the wrong test file; this one doesn't refer to an image
creator: gadams@apache.org

text: since fop-pdf-images 2.X is built against FOP1.0 and XGC 1.4, it may need to be rebuilt against FOP 1.1rc1 and XGC 1.5rc1 in order to operate correctly; have you tried using a new build against these new RC1 libs?
creator: gadams@apache.org

attached the good FO test file

text:
(In reply to comment #5)
> since fop-pdf-images 2.X is built against FOP1.0 and XGC 1.4, it may need to
> be rebuilt against FOP 1.1rc1 and XGC 1.5rc1 in order to operate correctly;
> have you tried using a new build against these new RC1 libs?

Tried unsuccessfully to build FOP-pdf-images against these 2 RC1 libs without any other change, I get 12 errors.

creator: psancho.asf@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 29165
Patch

I followed Vincent's instructions about which changes are necessary in order to restore compatibility, see also first post here:

http://apache-fop.1065347.n5.nabble.com/Merging-Temp-PDF-ObjectStreams-branch-to-trunk-td24601.html

I guess that the remaining class 'PDFBoxPDFImageHandler', which still causes compilation errors, can be removed.

I think it is very important that an updated version of the fop-pdf-images plugin is released before fop 1.1 comes out, because a lot of people use it. It would be very nice if somebody can review my changes.
creator: matthias8283@gmx.at

text:
Hi Matthias/Glenn,

I've made the necessary amendments to the code, it now compiles/runs with the FOP1.1rc1 JAR. Thanks for the work Matthias, I used your work but had to make a few amendments, anyway, it's done. We need to release this, I'm not sure what the procedure is, Glenn do you want to take charge of that?

Mehdi
creator: med1985@gmail.com
